oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Program, The Nashville Community Playhouse, presentation of “The Taming of the Shrew,” 1947 April
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Nashville Community Playhouse program for a theatrical production of William Shakespeare’s “The Taming of the Shrew,” presented April 16th-23rd, 1947. The Nashville Community Playhouse production was directed by Raymond Johnson. Settings and costumes designed by Frank Suiter, Lighting by Bill Alder and Tom Bolles, detailed set painting by Christine Tibbott and Terry Tomlin. The “entire production executed under the supervision of Wyman Kane; music played by Martha Eatherly.” The actors in the play included Eleanor Hankins Fort, Jim Reppert, Robert Goldman, Mack Sweeney, Carmen Mathews, Jane Dabney, Sherry Hanburry, Sam Tarpley, James Maddux, Harriet Tyne, Wyman Kane, Raymond Johnson, William Bell, Catharine Winnia, Billy Coble, Clara Caldwell, Bobby Wiener, Tommy Young, Frank Suiter, Frank Drury, Amanda Cayce, Clara Caldwell, Dorothy Hassell, Harriette Hassell, Jean Wade, Billy Coble, Frank Suiter, Bobby Wiener, and Tommy Young. Forms part of the Wilhelmina Webb Collection. 1 program.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Raymond
